newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek stocks add 0.89pct on upbeat industrials.
newsitem.headline: Greek stocks add 0.89pct on upbeat industrials.

text.p: Greek stocks moved to the upside on Thursday on upbeat industrial heavyweights but came off their highs in late trading -- the benchmark index settling 0.89 percent higher on the day.

"The general index will continue to fluctuate within the 1,570-1,630 trading range in the near-term because the market does not have great expectations for a wide deviation of stock prices from current levels," said Michael Dimitropoulos, chief analyst at Eurocorp-Banque Worms.

"Investors do not anticipate to be hit by major market-moving news and this translates into thin trading," he added. "But any positive developments in the macroeconomy will fuel optimism as prices appear very well-based."
Other market watchers said the market offered some very interesting short-term plays in blue chips even though turnover was low.
"The market remains vibrant despite some notable absenteeism during the summer holiday period," said a fund manager.
There are plenty of profitable opportunities around in blue chips such as Hellenic Bottling which oscillate wildly over a horizon of a few days, even during intra-day trading, the fund manager added.
"Greek stocks are attractively priced in relation to drachma interest rates and stock prices in competing emerging markets," said Dimitropoulos.
The Athens general index added 0.89 percent or 14.17 points to 1,598.34 from Wednesday's 1,584.17 close, with an intra-day high set at 1,601.70.
Industrials led the market with a 1.74 percent climb, mostly attributed to Hellenic Bottling's 5.07 percent rise and strong performance in cement stocks.
Turnover picked up to 14.3 billion drachmas on volume of 3.9 million shares, boosted by block trading.
Advancers outpaced decliners 109 to 95 with 26 shares unchanged on 230 traded.
OTE telecom Global Depository Shares (GDS) were quoted on London's SEAQ International market at $10.65-$10.95. Two GDSs make up one share of OTE.
